meanings.sent1: The weather forecast was iffy, so I brought an umbrella just in case.
meanings.sent2: She felt iffy about the new student until she got to know him better.
meanings.sent3: It's iffy whether the cat will catch the laser pointer or not.
meanings.sent4: His promise to always be there for her seemed as iffy as a soap bubble.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge looked iffy, but we crossed it carefully.

meanings.sent1: The iffy website had a lot of pop-up ads and sketchy links.
meanings.sent2: He considered the used car iffy because of its high mileage.
meanings.sent3: The magician's iffy tricks made the audience laugh more than gasp.
meanings.sent4: Her excuse for being late was as iffy as a wet paper bag.
meanings.sent5: The iffy alibi fell apart under questioning.
